plurals.description: Plural form content description for number of new notifications [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
plurals.name: mtrl_badge_content_description

resources.string: You are ready to use TalkBack.\n\nKeep learning about other topics now, or review this info anytime in TalkBack settings.
Press search with arrows to navigate
Press %1$s to see the list of shortcuts
Move between items, scroll, use menus, and more

string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to expand a bottomsheet halfway to its full height. [CHAR LIMIT=25]
string.name: bottomsheet_action_expand_halfway

resources.string: No text to copy, select some text first.
No text to cut, select some text first.
No text to delete, select some text first.
No text to paste, copy some texts first.
%1$s won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device.
%1$s won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are currently updating.
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
After selecting text, double-tap actions and then copy.\n\nTry to copy a word in the text box below.
After selecting text, you can copy it in the TalkBack menu. Swipe down and then right to open the TalkBack menu. Double-tap editing options and then copy.\n\nTry to copy a word in the text box below.

You can also reverse either of these gestures.

Swipe left with 3 fingers to select the previous reading control.

Swipe up with 1 finger to move the navigation focus backward or adjust a reading control up.

You can customize your reading controls in TalkBack settings.

You can also reverse either of these gestures.

Swipe up and then down to select the previous reading control.

Swipe up to move the navigation focus up or adjust a reading control up.

You can customize your reading controls in TalkBack settings.

To cut or paste text, open the TalkBack menu and double-tap actions.

To paste text, triple-tap with 3 fingers.

Try to paste a word in the text box below.
To cut or paste text, open the TalkBack menu and double-tap editing options.\n\nTry to paste a word in the text box below.
After selecting Read from top or Read from next, you can navigate to the previous or next element while the text is being read. This lets you go back or skip ahead with ease.
This turns off the display to improve privacy so your screen is not visible to others when in public places
Are you sure you want to turn off Explore by touch?\n\nYour device will no longer respond to shortcut gestures or speak items when you touch the screen.
Are you sure you want to turn on performance statistics?\n\nPerformance statistics may consume more memory and power.
Are you sure you want to turn on node tree debugging?\n\nNode tree debugging exposes the content of your screen to your device\'s logs, which may be read by other applications.
Verbose logging can aid in debugging but may cause personal information to appear in the system log buffer.\n\n Do you want to enable verbose logging?
When you hear a chime, you can use a system gesture that isn\'t supported by TalkBack. This is known as a pass-through gesture.
Are you sure you want to suspend TalkBack?\n\nWhile TalkBack is suspended, your device will not provide feedback and Explore by Touch will be disabled.

Here are some things you can say:

• Copy
• Read from next item
• Find [save]
• Speak [faster]
• TalkBack settings

Say "%1$s" for a list of all voice commands
Skip TalkBack gestures to use system gestures
Use voice commands to control TalkBack
Node tree has been printed to logs.
You can come back to it anytime in TalkBack settings.
You can focus on an item by dragging your finger across the screen.\n\nTry this now by touching the screen and dragging toward the bottom left corner until you find the next button.
Swipe right to find the finish button.
To open your accessibility shortcut, swipe up from the bottom of the screen with 3 fingers.
The gesture settings have been reset.
To go back, start at the left or right edge and swipe towards the middle of your screen with 2 fingers.
To go Home, swipe up from the bottom of your screen with 2 fingers.
To open notifications, swipe down from the top of the screen with 2 fingers. Then you can close notifications by swiping back up with 2 fingers.\n\nTry it now.
To open notifications, swipe down from the top of the screen with 2 fingers.
To go to your recent apps, swipe up from the bottom of your screen with 2 fingers and hold. Then release. This takes you to the overview screen.

To perform any system action, add 1 finger to the system gesture.

This means when using TalkBack, you can go Home by swiping up with 2 fingers instead of 1.

Trying these gestures now will close the tutorial. You may want to wait until you have completed the tutorial.

string.description: Content description for an icon that appears in the title area of a dialog
string.name: icon_content_description

resources.string:
Controls are items that you can interact with, like buttons, checkboxes, and text boxes.

On some pages, you may want to jump between controls to quickly find an action, like the next button.

To do this, swipe right with 3 fingers until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe up to go to the previous control on a page. Swipe down to go to the next control on a page.

Try it now. Switch to controls and find the next button.

Controls are items that you can interact with, like buttons, checkboxes, and text boxes.

On some pages, you may want to jump between controls to quickly find an action, like the next button.

To do this, swipe down and then up until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe up to go to the previous control on a page. Swipe down to go to the next control on a page.

Try it now. Switch to controls and find the next button.

You can also jump between headings on a page.

To try it now, swipe right with 3 fingers until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe down to find the "navigation" heading.

To finish the tutorial, swipe right to find the finish button.

You can also jump between headings on a page.

To try it now, swipe down and then up until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe down to find the "navigation" heading.

To finish the tutorial, swipe right to find the finish button.

You can also jump between links on a page.

To try it now, swipe right with 3 fingers until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe down to find the link named "continue". While in the tutorial, double tapping this link will not do anything.

Swipe right to find the next button and go to the next page.

You can also jump between links on a page.

To try it now, swipe down and then up until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe down and find the link named "continue". While in the tutorial, double tapping this link will not do anything.

Swipe right to find the next button and go to the next page.
Press key combination with %1$s modifier key to set new shortcut.
Press key combination to set new shortcut. It must contain at least ALT or Control key.
Press Backspace to clear the shortcut, press Enter to save, or press Escape to cancel.
TalkBack will reset keymap and change modifier key to %1$s
Modifier key has been changed to %1$s.
Search the screen for an item
Enter the text to be used as a label for this element\nInternal view name: %1$s
Nothing to export. You have not added any labels
Choose whether you want to override or skip existing labels in the case of conflict
There are currently no custom labels. You can create one by navigating to an unlabeled image and then adding a label from the Talkback Menu.

string.name: material_clock_toggle_content_description

string.name: material_hour_selection

string.name: material_hour_suffix

string.description: Description for button to switch to select the minute [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: material_minute_selection

string.description: spoken suffix for an amount of minutes in the clock [CHAR_LIMIT=16]
string.name: material_minute_suffix

string.description: Content description for the thumb with the maximum value in a Range slider. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: material_slider_range_end

string.description: Content description for the thumb with the minimum value in a Range slider. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: material_slider_range_start

string.description: Suffix for time in 12-hour standard, before noon. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: material_timepicker_am

resources.string: Switch to clock mode for the time input.

string.description: The label for a text field to select the hour on the time [CHAR_LIMIT=24]
string.name: material_timepicker_hour

string.description: The label for a text field to select the minute on the hour [CHAR_LIMIT=24]
string.name: material_timepicker_minute

string.description: Suffix for time in 12-hour standard, after noon. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: material_timepicker_pm

string.description: Title for the dialog with a time picker. [CHAR_LIMIT=32]
string.name: material_timepicker_select_time

resources.string: Switch to text input mode for the time input.

These shortcuts can help you quickly change settings, like switching your navigation from characters to words or changing TalkBack's speech rate.

To quickly change your reading controls, swipe left with 3 fingers or swipe right with 3 fingers.

You can customize the TalkBack menu and your reading controls later in TalkBack settings.

These shortcuts can help you quickly change settings, like switching your navigation from characters to words or changing TalkBack's speech rate.

To quickly change your reading controls, swipe down and then back up.

You can customize the TalkBack menu and your reading controls later in TalkBack settings.
The TalkBack menu includes settings and controls that you may need often.\n\nOpen the TalkBack menu now by tapping the screen with 3 fingers.
The TalkBack menu includes settings and controls that you may need often.\n\nOpen the TalkBack menu now by swiping down then right.
Are you sure you would like to reset your shortcut keys for this keymap to their default values? Please note, this action cannot be undone.
This helps TalkBack reduce announcements when you\'re on a call
This will reset all gestures to their default actions.\n\nYou will lose any changes that you have made.
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade or by returning to the lock screen
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade
You can resume TalkBack from the notifications shade or by turning the screen on
TalkBack now includes a braille keyboard so you can type faster with braille. To try it, go to TalkBack settings.

Global and local context menus, used to help you find settings and controls, are now united in a single TalkBack menu. You can open it by tapping with 3 fingers. Try it now.\n\nYour existing gestures will still take you to the new united menu: swipe down and then right.

Global and local context menus, used to help you find settings and controls, are now united in a single TalkBack menu.\n\nYour existing gestures, such as swipe down and then right, will still take you to the new united menu.
Now you can use your voice to control TalkBack quickly. Go to TalkBack settings to set up a gesture for voice command.
Now you can use your voice to control TalkBack quickly. To try it, %1$s.
When you have activated a text box, you can move the cursor between letters by swiping up or down.\n\nTry it in the text box below.

string.name: mtrl_badge_numberless_content_description

string.name: mtrl_picker_a11y_next_month

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button moves the calendar to the previous month [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_a11y_prev_month

string.name: mtrl_picker_announce_current_selection

string.name: mtrl_picker_cancel

string.description: Button text to indicate that the widget will save the user's selection [CHAR_LIMIT=16]
string.name: mtrl_picker_confirm

string.description: A single date [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_date_header_selected

string.name: mtrl_picker_day_of_week_column_header

string.name: mtrl_picker_invalid_format

string.description: Tells a user what format is expected for their date entry. [CHAR_LIMIT=18]
string.name: mtrl_picker_invalid_format_use

string.description: Notifies the user that the two entered dates do not represent a valid range of dates [CHAR_LIMIT=36]

string.name: mtrl_picker_navigate_to_year_description

string.description: Notifies the user that the entered date is outside the allowed range [CHAR_LIMIT=36]
string.name: mtrl_picker_out_of_range

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range where end date has been selected [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_end_selected

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range where start date has been selected [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_start_selected

string.description: Two dates separated by a dash representing a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_selected

string.description: Indicates that the user must take the action of picking dates within the calendar to form a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_title

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_unselected

string.description: Confirms the selection [CHAR_LIMIT=12]
string.name: mtrl_picker_save

string.description: Label for a single date selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_hint

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_range_end_hint

string.description: Label for the start date in a range selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_range_start_hint

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_day_abbr

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_month_abbr

string.description: A 1 character abbreviation for year. It will be part of a string such as dd/mm/yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy or y.mm.dd. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_year_abbr

string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_day_selection

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button changes the input mode to a text field [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button switches the user to choosing a year [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_year_selection

resources.string: Tap to switch to selecting a year

string.description: Button text to indicate that the widget will save the user's selection [CHAR_LIMIT=16]
string.name: mtrl_timepicker_confirm

resources.string: Tap to learn how to use TalkBack faster with new gestures.
Copied text. Usually, this will copy the text you have selected. Swipe right to continue.
To copy text, double-tap with 3 fingers.
Cut text. Usually, this will cut the text you have selected. Swipe right to continue.
To cut text, double-tap and hold with 3 fingers.
Note: You have customized some of your gestures, so this information may not be accurate. To review your gestures, go to TalkBack settings.
Pasted text. Usually, this will paste the text you have copied. Swipe right to continue.
To paste text, triple-tap with 3 fingers.
Media paused or playing. Usually, this will pause or play the current video or music. Swipe right to continue.
Other apps may use this gesture for things like answering or ending a phone call. This gesture may not be supported by all apps.
To pause or play media in a video or music app, double-tap with 2 fingers. Try it now.
To use the reading controls, swipe left or right with 3 fingers. You can also swipe up or down with 3 fingers.
Selection mode on or off. Usually, this will start or stop text selection mode when you are inside an input field. Swipe right to continue.
To start or end text selection mode, double-tap and hold with 2 fingers.
TalkBack speech stopped. Usually, this will stop the current phrase that TalkBack is saying. Swipe right to continue.
To stop TalkBack from talking temporarily, tap with 2 fingers.
New gestures have been added to make TalkBack faster and easier to use.\n\nOn this screen, you can try the new gestures.
To use this, go to TalkBack settings and add a gesture for \'%1$s\'
No applications found to export labels.
No applications found to import labels
Tap to review changes to accessibility gestures
This key combination is used for \'%1$s\' action. Do you want to clear it and assign this shortcut to \'%2$s\'?
Permission to send gestures to TalkBack and resume spoken feedback.
Try different gestures to learn what they do

Try any TalkBack gesture on this screen to hear what that gesture does.

Tap the screen with 2 fingers. Keep practicing by tapping once, twice, or three times with 2, 3, or 4 fingers.

You can also double-tap and hold with 2, 3, or 4 fingers.

Try any TalkBack gesture on this screen to hear what that gesture does.\n\nTry any gesture where two swipes form a right angle. For example, swipe down and then right, without lifting your finger in between.
To use the TalkBack menu, tap the screen with 3 fingers. You can also swipe up then right, or swipe down then right.
To use the TalkBack menu, swipe down then right.
To use the reading controls, swipe left or right with 3 fingers. You can also swipe up or down with 3 fingers.
To use the reading controls, swipe up then down.
%1$s to select a setting. Then %2$s to adjust the setting.
When you switch to other system windows like the status bar, notifications, or volume controls

Sometimes, you might want to hear text read aloud one character at a time.

To do this, swipe right with 3 fingers until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe up to move the navigation focus backward by character. Swipe down to move the navigation focus forward by character.

Try it now. When you swipe right with 3 fingers, you can also choose to read by words or paragraphs.

Sometimes, you might want to hear text read aloud one character at a time.

To do this, swipe down and then up until you hear "%1$s". Next, swipe up to move the navigation focus backward by character. Swipe down to move the navigation focus forward by character.

Try it now. When you swipe down and then up, you can also choose to read by words or paragraphs.
Read by character, word, or paragraph
Read by word or character, and jump between links, controls or headings
Here are gestures performed recently, please report which gesture is wrong and what is expected.
TalkBack accessibility service has hidden the screen
Do gesture %1$s to open TalkBack menu, highlight \"%2$s\", then double-tap.
You can scroll by swiping with 2 fingers.\n\nTry this now by swiping up with 2 fingers until you scroll to the bottom of the list items.

In a text box, move the cursor to the beginning of the text you want to select.

Double-tap and hold with 2 fingers to start selection mode. Then move the cursor to the end of the text. Double-tap and hold with 2 fingers again to end selection mode.

Try to select the word "Welcome" in the text box below.

In a text box, move the cursor to the beginning of the text you want to select.

Swipe down and then right to open the TalkBack menu. Double-tap actions and then start selection mode. Move the cursor to the end of the text.

Open the TalkBack menu again, then double-tap actions to end selection mode.

Try to select the word "Welcome" in the text box below.

These shortcuts can help you quickly change settings, like switching your navigation from characters to words or changing TalkBack's speech rate.

Step 1: Swipe right with 3 fingers to select the next reading control.

Step 2: Swipe down with 1 finger to move the navigation focus forward or adjust a reading control down.

These shortcuts can help you quickly change settings, like switching your navigation from characters to words or changing TalkBack's speech rate.

Step 1: Swipe down and then up to select the next reading control.

Step 2: Swipe down to move the navigation focus forward or adjust a reading control down.
Focus on first item on screen
Focus on last item on screen
Move navigation focus forward or adjust reading control down
Move navigation focus backward or adjust reading control up
These settings are removed from TalkBack, due to reliability issues:\n• Tap on side of device gestures\n• Shake to start continuous reading
Passwords only spoken when using headphones
Lower volume of other audio playing when TalkBack speaks
Read one character at a time
Open links within a focused item
Jump between items you can interact with, like buttons, checkboxes, and text fields
Copy the last phrase TalkBack said to the clipboard so you can paste the text
Shows when actions exist for the current item, including copy, paste, select, and more
Copy, paste, select, and more. Shows when you select a text box.
Read by character, word, lines, and more
Read one item at a time
Hide the display so your screen is not visible to others when in public places
Read out text embedded in a selected image
Shows when you select an unlabeled item
Jump between landmarks on web pages, like \"main\" or \"navigation\"
Change your spoken language. Shows only when you have multiple text-to-speech languages installed.
Read one line at a time
Read one paragraph at a time
Enter a search term to find that text on the screen
After describing content, suggest how to use
Speak deleted letters in a higher-pitched voice
When you select keyboard keys or navigate by character, you\'ll hear an example along with each letter, like \"h, hotel\"
Tap once on a focused item to activate
Use voice search key to print node tree instead of searching
Decrease other audio volume while speaking
Speak count for all scrolling methods
Starting from the next item, read all items on the screen
Starting from the top, read all items on the screen
Hear the last phrase that TalkBack said again
Change whether punctuation and symbols are read aloud
Change whether typed keys, usage hints, grid info, and other info is read aloud
Hide the display so your screen is not visible to others in public places. After hiding your screen, return it to a normal state.
Hear sound effects as you navigate, like a beep to confirm an action
Jump between special content on web pages, like tables
Spell each letter of the last phrase that TalkBack said
Go to all apps and Quick Settings
Feel vibrations for actions like selecting an item. Does not affect vibrations coming from apps or the system.
Go to the next or previous page. Shows when you are reading content with multiple pages.
Jump to other windows, like volume controls or the navigation bar
Read one word at a time
Braille keyboard isn\'t turned on. Go to TalkBack settings, set up Braille keyboard, and try again.

This version of TalkBack includes changes to the default accessibility gestures.

The up-then-down gesture will allow you to move to the first item on the screen, and the down-then-up gesture will move to the last item.

The reading granularity can now be changed by focusing an item, then selecting a granularity from the talkback context menu.

You can change the actions performed by these gestures in TalkBack Settings.

This version of TalkBack includes changes to the default accessibility gestures.\n\nThe up gesture now moves to the previous navigation setting, and the down gesture now moves to the next navigation setting.

This version of TalkBack includes changes to the default accessibility gestures. The actions associated with these gestures can be customized within TalkBack settings. When Explore by touch is enabled, you can use the following gestures to perform certain actions.\n\n%1$s
This tutorial requires TalkBack to be enabled. Please turn TalkBack on before launching the tutorial.

Adding ADB commands for TalkBack to allow developers and testers faster access

When TalkBack is on, it provides spoken feedback so that you can use your device without looking at the screen. This can be helpful for people who are blind or have low vision.

To navigate using TalkBack:
• Swipe right or left to move between items
• Double-tap to activate an item
• Drag two fingers to scroll

To turn off TalkBack:
• Tap the switch. You’ll see a green outline. Double-tap the switch.
• On the confirmation message, tap OK. Then double-tap OK.

When Talkback is on, it provides spoken feedback so that you can use your device without looking at the screen. Talkback is intended for situations or people who have difficulty seeing the screen.

How to use Talkback
• Swipe right or left to move between items
• Double-tap to activate an item
• Drag 2 fingers to scroll

How to turn off Talkback

Volume Keys: Press &\; hold both volume keys for a few seconds.

Settings
• Tap the Use Talkback switch. You&apos\;ll see a green outline. Double-tap the switch.
• On the confirmation message, tap stop. Then double-tap Stop.
Swipe right to select a topic
Swipe with two fingers to switch pages.

You can get more detail about text in images automatically or when you need it.

For images that do not have a label: TalkBack will automatically read the text that appears.

For all images: Open the TalkBack menu and select "Describe text in image".

Images stay on your device and are never sent to Google. This means you can use both of these features without an internet connection.
Cover proximity sensor to stop speech
Open TalkBack at the Play Store
Speak notifications when screen is off
Always speak number of list items
Try it now. Swipe right with 3 fingers.
Try it now. Swipe down and then up.
Move your finger across the keyboard. When you hear the letter you want to type, lift your finger.\n\nTry activating the text box below and type your name.
You can also type with the braille keyboard. Find it in TalkBack settings.

You will get simplified volume controls, quicker action controls, and more.

You will learn about key updates and changes in the next few screens. This will take about 5 minutes.

You can review this information in TalkBack settings at any time.

When you activate a text box, a keyboard opens at the bottom of your screen.

To dismiss the keyboard, double-tap the back button in the bottom left corner of your screen.

Try activating and dismissing the text box below.
Press arrow buttons to change value, or press select to finish.
Long press volume up and down keys
Hold finger to select any key, then double-tap
Hold finger to select letter key, then lift. Double-tap for other keys.
Hold finger to select any key, then lift
Voice commands are not available while the screen is locked. To use the TalkBack menu instead, %1$s.
Show available actions for the current item
To use voice commands, swipe right then up. Say \"Help\" or \"What can I say?\" anytime for this list of commands.
Go Home, go back, show notifications, and more
Repeat \"find\" to go to the next item that includes the text \"save\"
Find specific content on the current screen
Find the first item that includes the text \"save\" on the current screen
Move to the first item on the current screen
Hide the display so your screen isn\'t visible to others in public places
For best results, say the exact wording listed on the following screens.
Add or edit a custom label to say \"submit\"
Move to the last item on the current screen
Navigate by words, characters, lines, paragraphs, headings, controls, and more
Go to the next heading, control, list, or landmark
Go to TalkBack settings, hide screen, see actions, add custom labels, and more
Change how you read content on the current screen
Enter a search term to find that text on the screen
After hiding your screen, return it to a normal state
Change to low, high, or custom
Please try again in a moment
To use this feature, you must grant permission to use the microphone.
Sorry! This feature is not available on your device
Can\'t recognize this command. Say \"%1$s\" for the list of all commands.

You can use your voice to control TalkBack quickly.

For example, say a command to change navigation, jump to the next heading, copy text, and more.

To try it now, swipe right and then up.
Say \"%1$s\" for the list of all commands.

To improve volume control, volume keys do not control text cursors or sliders anymore.

To change the position of a slider, swipe up or down.

To change the position of the text cursor, swipe up or down in a text box. This also works in braille keyboard reading controls.
Please check if the phone is connected.
Swipe right or left to move between items
New gestures have been added to make TalkBack faster and easier to use.\n\nOn this screen, you can try the new gestures. You can review this information in TalkBack settings at any time.

TalkBack is a screen reader intended for situations or people who have difficulty seeing the screen. It gives you spoken feedback so that you can use your device without looking at the screen.

You can turn TalkBack on or off by holding both volume keys for several seconds.

When TalkBack is on, the focused item on the screen is spoken out loud.

Swiping right will move to the next item, and swiping left will move to the previous item.

Swipe right now to find the next button.

You will get new, easier gestures, simpler menus, voice control, and more.

You will learn about key updates and changes in the next few screens. This will take about 5 minutes.

You can review this information in TalkBack settings at any time.

You will get simpler menus, voice control, and more.

You will learn about key updates and changes in the next few screens. This will take about 3 minutes. 

You can review this information in TalkBack settings at any time.
You can switch between different sections on your screen, like the notification bar, main content, and keyboard.\n\nTo use window navigation, swipe down with 4 fingers.

You can switch between different sections on your screen, like the notification bar, main content, and keyboard.\n\nTo use window navigation, swipe down and then up. Keep going until you have selected window navigation. To navigate to the window, swipe down.
